title:
Interrupted time series analysis of clickbait on worldwide news
  websites, 2016-2023
abstract:
Clickbait is deceptive text that can manipulate web browsing, creating an
information gap between a link and target page that literally baits a user into
clicking. Clickbait detection continues to be well studied, but analyses of
clickbait overall on the web are limited. A dataset was built consisting of
451,033,388 clickbait scores produced by a clickbait detector which analyzed
links and headings on primarily English news pages from the Common Crawl. On
this data, 5 segmented regression models were fit on 5 major news events and
averaged clickbait scores. COVID and the 2020 US Election appeared to influence
clickbait levels.
